title: x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx cannot compile zstd
body:
I tried this code: ```rust fn main() { const INPUT: &[u8] = b"Rust is a multi-paradigm system programming language focused on safety, especially safe concurrency. Rust is syntactically similar to C++, but is designed to provide better memory safety while maintaining high performance."; let mut buffer = std::vec![0u8; 256]; let written = zstd_safe::compress(&mut buffer, INPUT, 3).unwrap(); let compressed = &buffer[..written]; let mut buffer = std::vec![0u8; 256]; let written = zstd_safe::decompress(&mut buffer, compressed).unwrap(); let decompressed = &buffer[..written]; assert_eq!(INPUT, decompressed); } ``` and the Cargo.toml dependencies is that ``` [dependencies] zstd-safe = {version = "6.0.1", features = ["std"], default-features = false} ``` ### Meta
use target: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu compile success

``` Compiling libc v0.2.139 Compiling zstd-safe v6.0.2+zstd.1.5.2 Compiling jobserver v0.1.25 Compiling cc v1.0.78 Compiling zstd-sys v2.0.4+zstd.1.5.2 Compiling hello v0.1.0 (/root/hello) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 8.63s ```

use target: x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx, compile failed

``` Compiling libc v0.2.139 Compiling zstd-safe v6.0.2+zstd.1.5.2 Compiling jobserver v0.1.25 Compiling cc v1.0.78 Compiling zstd-sys v2.0.4+zstd.1.5.2 Compiling hello v0.1.0 (/root/hello) error: linking with `rust-lld` failed: exit status: 1 | = note: "rust-lld" "-flavor" "gnu" "--version-script=/tmp/rustc4CmBOv/list" "-e" "elf_entry" "-Bstatic" "--gc-sections" "-z" "text" "-z" "norelro" "--no-undefined" "--error-unresolved-symbols" "--no-undefined-version" "-Bsymbolic" "--export-dynamic" "-u" "__rust_abort" "-u" "__rust_c_alloc" "-u" "__rust_c_dealloc" "-u" "__rust_print_err" "-u" "/root/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx/lib" "-o" "/root/hello/target/x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx/debug/deps/hello-5eb81361850fec0b" "--gc-sections" "-pie" = note: rust-lld: error: undefined symbol: malloc >>> referenced by zstd_common.c:60 (zstd/lib/common/zstd_common.c:60) >>> zstd_common.o:(ZSTD_customMalloc) in archive /root/hello/target/x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx/debug/deps/libzstd_sys-3d5c9e5058a031ed.rlib rust-lld: error: undefined symbol: free >>> referenced by zstd_common.c:81 (zstd/lib/common/zstd_common.c:81) >>> zstd_common.o:(ZSTD_customFree) in archive /root/hello/target/x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx/debug/deps/libzstd_sys-3d5c9e5058a031ed.rlib error: could not compile `hello` due to previous error ```

As above two different taget compilations, x86_64-fortanix-unknown-sgx reports undefined symbol error when compiling. Is there any way to solve this problem?
